item.title: Ticket #986 (Code Cleanup: Tabs instead of Four Spaces) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
If we do this, let's wait for a major release. I personally loathe tabs, but the official WP coding guidelines require them. So, doing a big tabify commit at the start of our next major release development cycle could happen. I'd rather not churn the files in the 1.5 dot releases.

item.title: Ticket #983 (Atom feed date/time format incorrect) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Let's keep it as Z and get the UTC time properly.

the_time('Y-m-d\TH:i:s\Z');

becomes:

get_post_time('Y-m-d\TH:i:s\Z', true);

item.title: Ticket #901 (apply_filters's handling of extra arguments is broken) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: It seems to me that the 'function:2' method would add yet more overhead, and I seem to recall reading we're trying to cut out overhead, not add more in. I'd go with only the function add_filter($tag, $function_to_add, $priority = 10, $number_of_arguments = 1) method.

item.title: Ticket #987 (Hello World needs post slug) updated
item.dc:creator: MaThIbUs
item.description: I marked this as "Major" because it would be pretty shitty if a user quickly wanted to test out the mod_rewrite magic that's built into WP, and stumbled upon a 404 page.

item.title: Ticket #987 (Hello World needs post slug) updated
item.dc:creator: MaThIbUs
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #987 (Hello World needs post slug) created
item.dc:creator: MaThIbUs
item.description:
In wp-admin/install.php, the first post ("Hello world!") gets inserted into the WP database. However, no post slug ("post_name") is stored in the DB. That way, unless the user edits and saves the first post, the rewritten permalink to that post won't work, as there's no slug!

We don't want stuff like ​http://someblog.ext/2005/02/26// instead of ​http://someblog.ext/2005/02/26/hello-world/ to happen, do we?

item.description: WordPress can be made even more lightweight by replacing every instance of four repetitive spaces by a tab. I did this for the whole wp-includes/ directory. [Patch included.] Its size went from 406,374 bytes to 383,963 bytes. Spaces are all over the place.

item.title: Ticket #983 (Atom feed date/time format incorrect) updated
item.dc:creator: darkcanuck
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #983 (Atom feed date/time format incorrect) created
item.dc:creator: darkcanuck
item.description:
The date format required by Atom 0.3 is ISO8601 (see ​http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime). However, for all entries the local date/time is being recorded but with the timezone as "Z" (which is UTC according to ISO8601).

The time zone should be set to +hh:mm to indicate the offset from UTC. Alternatively, WP could use the gmt time instead and keep the "Z" timezone.

Note that the feed modified element is being set correctly using the GMT time.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Download Atom feed
  2. Check date/time fields for any element's modified or issued entries - they are local time but with the UTC timezone.

item.title: Ticket #973 (Wrong variable on line 509 of /wp-includes/links.php) updated
item.dc:creator: necrotic
item.description:
yes, I meant $orderby.

It'd be nice to have a way to choose the order manually, then. On my Blogroll, I like random order with 15 limit. On my links page, I want ABC order with no limit. I did some hacking to do it, but having the feature already there would be nice.

item.title: Ticket #973 (Wrong variable on line 509 of /wp-includes/links.php) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: $orderby (I suppose you mean that and not $order) picks up the database value for the category before being passed to get_links(). Changing it to null will ignore the database specified order. This is a change in behavior for get_links_list() that will result in lots of bug reports.

item.title: Ticket #973 (Wrong variable on line 509 of /wp-includes/links.php) updated
item.dc:creator: necrotic
item.description:
If that's the case, rboren, then $orderby should be changed to something like null in the get_links call.

item.title: Ticket #980 (wp-register.php not sending email) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I mailed my hosting company asking what restrictions they had on mail sent via php scripts and they replied with:

Hello,

To be able to send a script generated mail through the server you have to set either the recipient's e-mail address (the "To:" header) or the sender's e-mail address (the "From:" header) to be an e-mail address from your hosted domain on the server.

The "From:" header is required to be present and to be preceding the "To:" header.

You can find out more information here: ​http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.mail.php

Here are examples of well working formmail scripts:

First Example:

<? $from = "From: yourname <youremail@…>"; $to = "receiver"; $subject = "Hi! "; $body = "TEST";

if(mail($to,$subject,$body,$from)) echo "MAIL - OK"; else echo "MAIL FAILED"; ?>

Second Example:

<? $from = "From: sender"; $to = "yourname <youremail@…>"; $subject = "Hi! "; $body = "TEST";

if(mail($to,$subject,$body,$from)) echo "MAIL - OK"; else echo "MAIL FAILED"; ?>

item.title: Ticket #943 (Edit page takes you to wrong tab) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=484 And a patch that worked at one point: ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=799 no clue if it works anymore.

item.title: Ticket #943 (Edit page takes you to wrong tab) updated
item.dc:creator: darkcanuck
item.description:
Confirmed this on my site too (WP1.5, latest CVS). Also reported in the forums: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=25181

To reproduce:

  • go to Manage Pages sub menu and select "Edit" for any page,

OR

  • click on "Edit This" link for any page on site.

Both will display the page under the "Write Post" tab. The heading directly underneath does display "Write Page", however.

item.title: Ticket #981 (PHP Warning displayed on Write Page tab) updated
item.dc:creator: darkcanuck
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #981 (PHP Warning displayed on Write Page tab) created
item.dc:creator: darkcanuck
item.description:
When navigating to the Write Page tab, the following PHP warning message is displayed: Warning: strtotime() [function.strtotime]: Called with an empty time parameter. in /home/lavigne/public_html/vapourtrails/wordpress/wp-includes/template-functions-links.php on line 55

The message appears between the "Write Page" header and the the Page Title entry box.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Login as admin
  2. Click on "Write" top-level menu.
  3. Click on "Write Page" sub-menu.

This issue has also been reported in the support forums: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=23811#post-134712

This may be related to PHP 5.0.2 since they have posted a warning about incorrect values for "now" (the optional parameter that is generating the warning). See ​http://ca3.php.net/strtotime for details.
